website_summaries.verdict: It's an imperfect technology, but the Celluon Epic is the best virtual keyboard for everyday use with its responsive keyboard that is clearly visible on most surfaces and an easy-to-use mouse feature.
pros: The Celluon is as compact and portable as other virtual keyboards, but manages to surpass the rest in keyboard visibility and keystroke response
The mouse feature is intuitive to use and works on both Windows and Mac operating systems
cons: The keyboard is difficult to see on darker surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Works well and fun to use. Project on the right surface though. It's a red laser so obviously it wouldn't show up well on a redwood table haha. It also worked on my frosted glass table. but since the glass portion is transparent the keyboard showed on the frosted portion of the glass and so the keyboard would display lower than where you can press.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: It works... and its actually accurate. ...
customer_reviews.text: It works...and its actually accurate...I type slowly so i don't know if this would work for others. But hooray for technology...
customer_reviews.author: Gagan

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is small
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than an average computer keyboard, Be careful of the surface you are projecting it onto. It is just a bit too difficult to type on if you are a fast typer. Sometimes it just simply doesn't pick up what I'm typing. It was a bit too frustraing so I barely use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: J Walt

customer_reviews.title: I've never in my life experienced a more disappointing product than this pile of garbage. If you buy this
customer_reviews.text: This deserves a negative star, but it's not allowed. I've never in my life experienced a more disappointing product than this pile of garbage. If you buy this, your a fool

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and worked in a lit room

customer_reviews.title: Very cool durable gadget
customer_reviews.text: Very cool durable gadget, but not super practical. Price on Amazon is cheaper than other places online & retail stores. A great gift for the tech & gadget person in your life, but they'll be the only ones who'll use it & glad they have it.
customer_reviews.author: joe dorpat

customer_reviews.title: great product, very
customer_reviews.text: It exceeded my expectation. of course laser is not clearly visible on daylight but I wasn't expecting it to magically show up in every lighting condition. reading speed is faster than I expected it to be. they advertise that it's 350 key per minute and I do believe it's true. great product, very cool
customer_reviews.author: Nika Begiashvili

customer_reviews.title: very cool technology I'm very happy that I bought this laser ...
customer_reviews.text: very cool technology I'm very happy that I bought this laser keyboard extremely worth it well design even know that the technology is not there yet highly recommended you will impress your friends and people around you

customer_reviews.title: amazing keyboard product
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great product to have... I just wish you could see it better on a wood top desk.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gadget
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gadget. Not sure how useful it is, but it impresses a lot of people who have asked me "what is it?". But it does work exactly the way it's advertised.

customer_reviews.title: Certainly not the equivalent of a full size keyboard, ...
customer_reviews.text: Certainly not the equivalent of a full size keyboard, but quite functional and small. Just put this tiny thing in your pocket and compose on your phone or tablet.

customer_reviews.title: couldn't get this to work properly and comfortably. I may be stuck in my ways of ...
customer_reviews.text: couldn't get this to work properly and comfortably. I may be stuck in my ways of needing to feel the keys to type, but I wasn't happy. I resold mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for your pc that's plugged into the TV
customer_reviews.text: Really fun toy. It takes some getting use to. Switching between keyboard and mouse mode is really quick and simple. I wouldn't write a paper using this. But when I want to watch netflix on my television it's really practical

customer_reviews.title: It's very nice, only
customer_reviews.text: It's very nice, only it is in English and can not modicar to Spanish, not have the "ñ". but is nice.

customer_reviews.title: Novel product
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but still is not possible to type without looking at the keyboard. Also, cannot find Windows function keys.

customer_reviews.title: Great portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great to use on any cellphone. Fun, easy to use, portable keyboard, lights up.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of skeptical about this device when I read about it and was not sure that it would meet my needs. Not only does it meet my needs, it exceeds my expectations. Support for the device is readily available. The learning curve on using it is quick and I find it to be responsive and adaptable to all of my devices. I have used it on my Android devices as well as my laptop. It syncs well over blutooth with all of my devices. I am still configuring it to my preferences, but I like all of the features.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but impractical
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, good form factor but impractical due to insufficient accuracy of the finger detection. Even under ideal conditions as outlined in the user manual the laser keyboard did not perform well enough to replace the on-screen keyboard. I gave up after trying for three days and went back to using the Swipe on-screen keyboard. Colleagues and friends confirmed that they are also unable to get any practical use out of the laser keyboard after me lending it to them.
customer_reviews.author: Tino

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It is great except that if the light is not right, you can't really use the keyboard and it requires a smooth, flat surface. The slightest angle throws the keyboard off.

customer_reviews.title: Best I've had on a virtual keyboard

customer_reviews.title: And it was awesome! But someone stole it
customer_reviews.text: I visited Celluon office in Seoul to write an article about virtual keyboard a few years ago. I was really impressed! After then I ordered the keyboard for Christmas gift. And it was awesome! But someone stole it.... It was such a great gift, now it is gone. Such a shame... Every time when I enter my order history, I really miss my virtual keyboard :(

customer_reviews.title: Costs a little more but so convenient.

customer_reviews.title: novelty item, not for actually typing anything useful
customer_reviews.text: This device is for novelty purposes only. I would get a physical bluetooth keyboard and trackpad combo. Its great to show to a friend, but actually typing anything is extremely frustrating if you are even a moderate typed, its just not worth using. Typing on your phone screen keyboard is much faster. Pros. Looks cool Con's. Innacurate Can't touch type Slow response Mouse feature is not accurate. Certain surfaces are not supported. Miss hit keys Novelty item at best.

Not a defect.) but I can't even figure out the sequence of buttons to scroll through my contacts on purpose. If I can figure that out, and how to send a message on the keyboard, my rating would be a 5.

Takes a little getting used to at first, but set up and use is really easy! It's also a great conversation starter!

customer_reviews.title: Device would not type one word in English...
customer_reviews.text: Similar to a cell phone finishing a word while texting or writing an email, this device assumes the correct word in English, then changes it to a different language. Returning the product to amazon today :-(
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the future
customer_reviews.text: The rating is well deserved.. It did take a little bit of time to get used to. Once the settings were locked in the keyboard worked great. I will have to have a little cheat sheet for the Short cuts but after that it will be smooth. The keyboard worked better on my tablet than for my phone, I have Galaxy Note 10.1 AND Galaxy Note 3. The mouse feature is great. You will find that it HAS to be on a level surface.
customer_reviews.author: Cyberdiver

customer_reviews.title: Virtual Keyboard for iPhone & iPad mini
customer_reviews.text: This virtual keyboard works extremely well, and makes entries in my iPhone and iPad mini very easy. It is much faster, for me, than using the on screen keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Tripol'e

customer_reviews.title: Paid Full Price; Now See it On Sale for Half What I Paid
customer_reviews.text: It's quite disconcerting to see a company market a device over the internet or on Amazon and get people like me to pay full boat retail. Then in a matter of two weeks of receiving it, I get an e-mail from "Brad's Deals" showing the same device is now available for half what I paid. I hope you Cellulon folks are reading this review, because I think I deserve an explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Gray

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: Has a bit of learning curve to be able to use it effectively. Still struggling with the mouse movements.. but works fairly well

customer_reviews.title: Future Keyboard & Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, arrived quickly, and in original box. The keyboard works very well with all of my mobile devices. and is extremely useful for bridging the gap between a pad device and a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Issues Fixed!
customer_reviews.text: OK. So an update. I previously was "disappointed" in this, as it didn't work at all with my Android 4.3 Nexus 2nd gen tablet. Android 4.4 came out and has fixed this issue. So, I'll give it 4 stars now. It still is a bit finicky w/ finger placement, and I'd like to be able to decrease the volume even more (it can be silent or with a varying volume of beeps w/ each keystroke). I'd like a little more options for volume, that's all. Just me being picky.
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Virtual keyboard.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product is even worse than their previous device, the magic cube, it will not connect to my computer via USB and keeps giving me keys when I do not press them! Do not waste your money!!

product_meta.title: Celluon EPIC Ultra-Portable Full-Size Virtual Keyboard
product_meta.description: Epic is a mobile projection keyboard that doubles as a virtual multi-touch mouse. With a single flick of switch, Epic projects a full-size QWERTY keyboard in a safe form of laser. It is easily paired with any smart devices by simplified Bluetooth capability. It is compatible with iOS 4.0 and later, Android 4.0 and later, Windows XP and later, Blackberry 10, and any other Bluetooth HID devices. Epic can be used virtually on any flat and opaque surfaces as an input device.
feature_bullets: Compatible with any devices with these operating systems: iOS4+, Android 4.0+, Mac OS X 10+, Windows XP+, Blackberry 10 devices.
Built-in Lithium-ion Polymer Battery, Capacity: 660 mAH @ 3.7V
Works on all flat, opaque surface.
Adjustable brightness, sensitivity and sound feedback.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars148 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
